column4: hello, can some one help me , i have been getting some weird problems ..
it was working just fine yesterday , then i had some bugs going on when i installed kiba-dock
you will have to be more specific about your problems to get meaningful help
its like this i can open google, but not yahoo, i can open microsoft but not appe, and the when i try to run the upgrade manager it downloads some upgrades but not others...
which version of ubuntu did you install?
the latest stable (edgy eft) or the latest unstable (feisty fawn)?
the ipv6 might help you.  the other thing, is that just another partition of your hd which you don't see or is it a real 2 disk?
yeah its anothe hd it worked on my last install, but i cant see it now.. altho the bios an dthe install software sees it
can't see it as in 'there is no /dev/hda... for my drive' or as in 'it's not automatically mounted on boot into a special directory'?
i cant see it as in theres no /dev/hdb
and dmesg | grep hdb isn't helpful either?
to be honest im sort of new to linux so i didnt know athts actualy existed and honestly o dont know what it does...
'dmesg | grep hdb' at a console run as root will output everything concerning hdb during startup of ubuntu. you'll probably need to run it with sudo : sudo dmesg | grep hdb
thx ill try it... if it dosent work ill be back.. im on my mates pc... thx alot...
there might be a hint on why hdb doesn't work, fingers crossed
ill be back soon .. realy thanx alot man
